caption:
This photograph features a close-up view of small, rounded leaves growing symmetrically along a thin branch or stem. The leaves are vibrant green and have a texture that suggests they are perhaps slightly hairy or fuzzy. The focus is sharp on the leaves and the stem, making their details quite prominent against a darker, out-of-focus background.

The lighting in the image creates a dramatic effect, with a bright light source (possibly the sun) shining through from behind the scene. This backlighting highlights the edges of the leaves and creates a lens flare effect, introducing rays and scattered light reflections into the left side of the frame. These light effects bring an ethereal or magical quality to the image, enhancing the natural beauty of the subject.

The overall mood is serene and somewhat mysterious, emphasizing the natural elements and the interplay of light and shadow. The composition skillfully uses the light to draw the viewerâ€™s attention to the delicate shapes of the leaves, highlighting the simple beauty of nature.
title: Close- up of new leaves just budding out on as fern, with the sun shining through the leaves and stem so some of the cellular structure is visable.  Photo taken at nitinat triangle, vancouver island, british Columbia.  Near port alberni, british Columbia, canada.  From the environmental protection agencys project documerica collection, "in praise of forests".  For additional images see fiche #s 209, 210, 211, 212, and 213.  Entheos.  June, 1973.
